Notes.Text:
The python-keystoneclient was updated to fix one security issues.

The following vulnerability was fixed:
- bsc#928205: S3Token TLS cert verification option not honored (CVE-2015-1852)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Cloud Compute Node for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 5
SUSE Cloud Compute Node for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 5

Vulnerabilities.Description: The s3_token middleware in OpenStack keystonemiddleware before 1.6.0 and python-keystoneclient before 1.4.0 disables certification verification when the "insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) file regardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-7144.

ProductID: SUSE Cloud Compute Node for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 5:python-keystoneclient-1.0.0-16.1
